page.title: 02Deer Forest Cont
page.content: centre there are no way marked paths through the woods, and members of the public are only allowed to drive up the rough road to Mill Dam if they have purchased a license to fish for trout in season. Pulney Loch may also be fished by permit. The woods are actively managed and there is a small sawmill on the old main road with of the village. There are only a handfull of houses away from the road, mostly used by tenant farmers or estate workers such as the gamekeeper at Bikerburn, who culls the roe deer, which are hard to spot beneath the bracken in summer until you get up wind of them, and they start to jump. A few red deer come ffrom further north in winter.
